definition: daily lower limit on the price of a stock
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: You count for me how many limits it will have to seventeen.
sentences.chinese: 你算算，需要多少个跌停板才能使股价掉到十七元。

sentences.english: You can't sell stocks before the decline limit ends.
sentences.chinese: 跌停板打开之前，你根本卖不掉股票。

sentences.english: Few people can sell stocks when the decline limit comes because few people dare to buy stock on this occasion.
sentences.chinese: 跌停板时，几乎没有人买股票，当然就卖不出股票了。

sentences.english: Jack isn't in panic in front of the decline limit because he is a newcomer.
sentences.chinese: 杰克面对跌停板没有恐慌，那是因为他是个新手。

sentences.english: With willingness, buy at limit up and sell at limit down.
sentences.chinese: 只要顺势，心甘情愿在涨停板买入，在跌停板卖出。

sentences.english: Steel futures there fell by their 5% limit.
sentences.chinese: 上海期交所钢铁期货触及了5%的跌停板。

definition: daily upper limit on the price of a stock
